intro: Acropogon domatifer, commonly known as the domatifer grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, greenish flowers. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks. Acropogon domatifer is adapted to thrive in humid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native regions.
